stories.headline: Seven Deadly Sins: Survey Reaches Biblical Proportions
stories.summary: The Greensboro News & Record conducted a survey on perceptions of sin in the Bible Belt community using computer-assisted reporting, highlighting the integration of modern technology in traditional reporting practices.

stories.headline: Scanners May Eliminate Data Entry Problems
stories.summary: The Boston Herald and other newspapers face challenges with data entry for computer-assisted reporting projects, with some looking into scanners as potential solutions to improve accuracy and reduce manual efforts.

stories.headline: Portrait of a Slum Lord: Database Analysis Uncovers Neighborhood Tragedy
stories.summary: Dee Lane uses computer-assisted reporting to expose a slumlord in Portland, demonstrating the power of databases in quickly advancing investigative journalism on systemic issues.
